title: Foundations of Vehicle Internet Distributed Learning: Theory and Experimentation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistical Knowledge, Fundamental Machine Learning Concepts, and Understanding of Simple Networks
context.additional_context: Students perform distributed learning simulations on personal devices, experiencing a vehicle-to-vehicle collaborative learning model. They explore data privacy and learning efficiency in a simplified virtual scenario of a real IoV (Internet of Vehicles) environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of distributed learning and describe a vehicle-to-vehicle collaborative learning process in three distinct phases
Learners can perform simulations to protect personal information by applying data masking techniques in a virtual vehicle network environment.
The advantages of a hierarchical distributed learning framework can be comparatively evaluated in terms of learning accuracy, security, and signal efficiency.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
